title: (x) meat on the menu - Cheltenham {Stephen, Mark S}
content:
[http://static.flickr.com/29/48469477\_1171c015e5\_b.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225853/http:/static.flickr.com/29/48469477_1171c015e5_b.jpg "http://static.flickr.com/29/48469477\_1171c015e5\_b.jpg")

Thanks!

Eric

 [‹ Font used in Shrek](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225853/http:/typophile.com/node/799 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dentyne Ice gum logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225853/http:/typophile.com/node/15433 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Eric_West

comments.content: The larger italic type is [Cheltenham Oldstyle Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225853/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=BT.1270.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Swiss+Steak&sampleSize=48), an old favorite of mine.
Thanks guys, I was still stumped by the swashy lc k.

I have some 18 pt. metal Cheltenham Italic for that same reason, Mark. Also because the _New York Times_ uses [Carter’s version](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019225853/http:/www.nytimes.com/imagepages/2003/10/20/business/21PAPE.chart.jpg.html) for their heads.
